title: Python 2.7 compatibility: AttributeError: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'is_sparse'
body_html:
The following fails:

torch.from_numpy(np.array([1,2,3])).type(u'torch.DoubleTensor')
  File ".../torch/_utils.py", line 33, in _type
    if new_type.is_sparse:
AttributeError: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'is_sparse'

The reason why all strings are unicode is because I am using from __future__ import unicode_literals.
body_text:
The following fails:
torch.from_numpy(np.array([1,2,3])).type(u'torch.DoubleTensor')
  File ".../torch/_utils.py", line 33, in _type

AttributeError: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'is_sparse'

The reason why all strings are unicode is because I am using from __future__ import unicode_literals.
body:
The following fails:

```python
torch.from_numpy(np.array([1,2,3])).type(u'torch.DoubleTensor')
```

```
  File ".../torch/_utils.py", line 33, in _type
    if new_type.is_sparse:
AttributeError: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'is_sparse'
```

The reason why all strings are unicode is because I am using `from __future__ import unicode_literals`.
